intro: Epilobium angustifolium var. pleniflorum, commonly known as narrow-leaved willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in spikes. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wet meadows and riverbanks. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
